Media.MediaTitle: bladder cancer stage IVA and IVB

ImageData.LabelName: Stage IVA and IVB Bladder Cancer
b) Cancer in lymph nodes above the common iliac arteries
a) Cancer spread to abdominal or pelvic wall
c) Spread to other parts of the body

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Diversity updates: Changed figure to an older male; added grey hair; kept skin tone as is

Added brackets on each side of the common iliac arteries, going from where they join the main artery at the top to where they branch into the external iliac arteries at the bottom (right where the ureter crosses the blood vessels); took cancer out of lymph nodes near the bladder; Changed label for a) to say “Cancer spread to abdominal or pelvic wall”; Changed the title to say "Stage IVA and IVB Bladder Cancer".
Changed title to Stage IV A and B Bladder Cancer and changed label for Common iliac artery to plural.
Image revisions made per AJCC updates (8th edition)
Removed label Bladder from the inset; made cancer in pelvic wall larger and more prominant; and shortened the line from the label “Spread to pelvic wall” a bit to point to the edge of the cancer spot
Changed label from "Pelvic wall" to “Spread to pelvic wall”; faded out the cut off part of the colon that sticks up in the middle of the main figure

Image split into two panels with first panel showing a close up of cancer spread from the bladder to abdominal wall, and some specific abdominal lymph nodes; second panel shows the body with labels for lung, liver, and bone..

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IVA and IVB bladder cancer; drawing shows cancer that has spread from the bladder to (a) the abdominal or pelvic wall and (b) lymph nodes above the common iliac arteries. Also shown is cancer that has spread to (c) other parts of the body, including the lung, liver, and bone.

Stage IVA and IVB bladder cancer; drawing shows cancer that has spread from the bladder to (a) the abdominal or pelvic wall and (b) lymph nodes above the common iliac arteries. Also shown is cancer that has spread to (c) other parts of the body, including the lung, liver, and bone.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IVA and IVB bladder cancer. In stage IVA, cancer has spread to (a) the abdominal or pelvic wall; or (b) lymph nodes above the common iliac arteries. In stage IVB, cancer has spread to (c) other parts of the body, such as the lung, liver, or bone.

Stage IVA and IVB bladder cancer. In stage IVA, cancer has spread to (a) the abdominal or pelvic wall; or (b) lymph nodes above the common iliac arteries. In stage IVB, cancer has spread to (c) other parts of the body, such as the lung, liver, or bone.
